Staying Safe on the Road: Personal Safety Tips Always keep digital and physical copies of important documents like your passport, travel insurance, and emergency contacts. Be mindful of pickpockets in crowded areas and use an anti-theft backpack or money belt for added security. It’s also a good idea to share your itinerary with a trusted friend or family member in case of emergencies. Be cautious when using public Wi-Fi by using a VPN (virtual private network) to protect your data. Before arriving at your destination, research local emergency numbers and be aware of common scams to watch out for. Be Flexible and Open-Minded Things don’t always go according to plan when traveling, and that’s okay!
